programme.title: Women's 3000m Steeplechase Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 3000m Steeplechase Final took place at Stade de France, on 06/08/24. Winfred Yavi (BRN) won Gold with an Olympic record time of 8:52.76 minutes. Peruth Chemutai (UGA) won Silver, and Faith Cherotich (KEN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Armand Duplantis: flying high and smashing records | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Sweden's Armand "Mondo" Duplantis confirmed his status as the best pole vaulter in the world by seizing his first Olympic pole vault title by storm.

programme.title: Elaine Thompson-Hera: One sprint to rule them all | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: How Elaine Thompson-Hera became the undisputed sprinting queen and the first woman to win the 100-200m double gold at consecutive Olympics.

programme.title: Neeraj Chopra: Throws his way into a nation's heart | Wait For It Tokyo 2020
programme.desc: Neeraj Chopra makes Olympic history with the first-ever Olympic gold medal in track-and-field for India.

programme.title: Mat B: Men's Greco-Roman & Women's Freestyle - Day 12 - Evening | Wrestling | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session includes the Men's Greco-Roman 67kg and 87kg Semifinals and the Greco-Roman 77kg and 97kg Finals as well as the Women's Freestyle 53kg Semifinals and the Freestyle 50kg Finals.

programme.title: Meet the Phogats | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Mahavir convenes a family lunch to discuss the futures of Dushyant and Sangeeta, urging them to train for the upcoming Paris 2024 Olympics. However, Geeta, who also aspires for a comeback in professional wrestling, feels neglected by Mahavir's focus.

programme.title: Living Up to Expectations | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: We delve into Geeta's life at the police academy, Babita's role in politics, and Ritu's MMA training in Singapore. Meanwhile, Dushyant and Sangeeta add a touch of fun with Instagram reels.

programme.title: Dushyant’s Time to Shine | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Dushyant reconnects with his roots in the family’s native village, spending time with Mahavir and his mother Daya Kaur. Babita pays a surprise visit to Mahavir’s training academy, supervising Dushyant and other students.

programme.title: Life and Love | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Explore Bajrang and Sangeeta’s love story, rooted in mutual support and a shared passion for wrestling. Gain insights into how each spouse supports their partner's dreams. Meanwhile, Dushyant and Ritu share their perspectives on relationships.

programme.title: Siblings Bonding | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Dushyant's first international trip takes him to Singapore to surprise Ritu, showcasing their sibling bond as they explore the city together and conquer their fear of heights with a bungee jump.

programme.title: From One Challenge to Another | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Sangeeta undergoes physiotherapy and trains at the sports academy, while Geeta discusses her comeback in wrestling. Dushyant works hard to improve his fitness, and Babita reflects on her decision to switch careers due to injury.

programme.title: Fun, Frolic and Fashion | Wrestling My Family
programme.desc: Witness Babita’s life as a wife and mother in a joint family while managing her career. She surprises everyone by designing clothes for her siblings, leading to a photo-shoot to launch her brand. Mahavir and Daya Kaur reminisce as they browse through old medals.

programme.title: Opening Series - Kite; Medal Races - Dinghy & Multihull - Day 12 | Sailing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session took place at Marseille Marina - Corniche, and Marseille Marina - Frioul, on 07/08/24.
In Women's Dinghy, Marit Bouwmeester (NED) won Gold, Anne-Marie Rindom (DEN) won Silver and Line Flem Hoest (NOR) won Bronze.
In Men's Dinghy, Matt Wearn (AUS) won Gold, Pavlow Kontides (CYP) won Silver and Stefano Peschiera (PER) won Bronze.

programme.title: Personal Best: Paris 2024
programme.desc: Relive the Paris 2024 Olympic Games through the journeys of eight remarkable athletes who pushed past limits, defied expectations, and inspired the world. Featuring Noah Lyles, Faith Kipyegon, Jack Robinson, Huang Yaqiong and Zheng Siwei, Leon Marchand, Olga Kharlan and Cindy Ngamba.

programme.title: The Santiago Lange story (extended version)
programme.desc: After five Olympic Games, the Argentine sailor still hadn’t found gold. And then came cancer. Could he win in Rio?

programme.title: Women's -49kg & Men's -58kg Repechages/Finals | Taekwondo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's -49kg & Men's -58kg Repechages/Finals which took place at the Grand Palais on 07/08/24.
The Women's -49Kg was won by Panipak Wongpattanakit (THA) with Gold, Qing Guo (CHN) with Silver and a tie in Bronze by Mobina Nematzadeh (IRI) and Lena Stojkovic (CRO).
The Men's -58kg was won by Taejoon Park (KOR) with Gold, Gashim Magomedov (AZE) with Silver and Bronze for Cyrian Ravet (FRA) and Mohamed Jendoubi (TUN).

programme.title: How fun fuels this Para-Taekwondo world champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: When Juan-Diego Garcia entered a dojang for the first time at age five, he knew he found his place. As success came against abled bodied competitors, other kids used to ask, “But he doesn’t have an arm, how did he win?” He always proved to himself and others he can do anything. Now, Mexico’s first-ever world champion in Para-Taekwondo is training harder than ever to represent his country and hometown at the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games where the sport will make its debut.

programme.title: Personal Best: Paris 2024
programme.desc: Relive the Paris 2024 Olympic Games through the journeys of eight remarkable athletes who pushed past limits, defied expectations, and inspired the world. Featuring Noah Lyles, Faith Kipyegon, Jack Robinson, Huang Yaqiong and Zheng Siwei, Leon Marchand, Olga Kharlan and Cindy Ngamba.

programme.title: Mat B: Men's Greco-Roman & Women's Freestyle - Day 12 - Evening | Wrestling | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This session includes the Men's Greco-Roman 67kg and 87kg Semifinals and the Greco-Roman 77kg and 97kg Finals as well as the Women's Freestyle 53kg Semifinals and the Freestyle 50kg Finals.

programme.title: Men's Lead Semi-Final, Women's Speed Final | Sport Climbing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Men's Boulder & Lead Semi-Final, the Women's Speed Quarter-Final, Women's Speed Semi-Final and the Women's Speed Final which took place at Le Bourget Sport Climbing Venue on 07/08/24.
The Women's Speed Final was won by Aleksandra Miroslaw (POL) with Gold, Deng Lijuan (CHN) with Silver and Aleksandra Kalucka (POL) with Bronze.

programme.title: How sport climbing star Shauna Coxsey found her sport | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Shauna Coxsey is a sport climbing sensation from the UK. With her motto “find something that makes you happy” she made it to the top and is now ready to step up to represent the sport at the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Bruce Lee first inspired this karate champion | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Saadi Abbas, a karateka from Pakistan, nearly gave up on his Olympic dream. After learning that the sport would join the Olympics in Tokyo, he jumped back into training despite injuries and a lack of funding. Now, he hopes to follow the example of Seoul 1988 bronze medallist Hussain Shah, who is from the same neighbourhood of Karachi, to qualify for the Tokyo Olympic Games.

programme.title: How Jordyn Barratt found herself through skateboarding | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Growing up in Hawaii, it’s not surprising that Jordyn was a surfer long before she stepped on a skateboard. But her life changed when she entered a skatepark for the first time. She finally felt at home and was able to express herself through her movements on the board. Now that skateboarding is an Olympic sport, she’s ready to represent her community on the biggest stage of all.

programme.title: How Peruvian star Lucca Mesinas fell in love with surfing | Unleash the New
programme.desc: Following his parents’ footsteps, Lucca fell in love with surfing at a young age thanks to long sessions in the water with family and friends. With a surprising competitive streak, Lucca has now qualified for the Tokyo 2020 Games, where surfing will make its Olympic debut.

programme.title: Personal Best: Paris 2024
programme.desc: Relive the Paris 2024 Olympic Games through the journeys of eight remarkable athletes who pushed past limits, defied expectations, and inspired the world. Featuring Noah Lyles, Faith Kipyegon, Jack Robinson, Huang Yaqiong and Zheng Siwei, Leon Marchand, Olga Kharlan and Cindy Ngamba.

programme.title: Men's Park Finals | Skateboarding | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Skateboarding Park Finals took place on La Concorde 4, France, 07/08/24. Keegan Palmer (AUS) won Gold with a total score of 221.9. Tom Schaar (USA) won the Silver Medal and Augusto Akio (BRA) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: The dazzling freestyle skateboarding skills of Isamu Yamamoto | Urbanity
programme.desc: Japanese skateboarding sensation, Isamu Yamamoto has been electrifying audiences worldwide with his freestyle skills and graceful dance-like moves.

programme.title: Rachelle Vinberg: New York City skate of mind | Urbanity
programme.desc: Skate Kitchen star Rachelle Vinberg combines her love of skateboarding and the city streets to give us a personal tour of her life and the “Big Apple”

programme.title: Mixed Dinghy Medal Race - MX Multihull Medal Race - Men's & Women's Kitesurfing SFs A & B, Finals Heats 1, 2 | Sailing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session took place at Marseille Marina - Corniche, and Marseille Marina - Frioul, on 07/08/24.
In Mixed Dinghy, Vadlau/Maehr (AUT) won Gold, Okada/Yoshioka (JPN) won Silver and Dahlberg/Karlsson (SWE) won Bronze.
In Mixed Multihull, Tita/Banti (ITA) won Gold, Majdalani/Bosco (ARG) won Silver and Wilkinson/Dawson (NZL) won Bronze.
In Women's Kite, Eleanor Aldridge (GBR) won Gold, Laudriane Nolot (FRA) won Silver and Annelous Lammerts (NED) won Bronze.

programme.title: The Santiago Lange story (extended version)
programme.desc: After five Olympic Games, the Argentine sailor still hadn’t found gold. And then came cancer. Could he win in Rio?

programme.title: Personal Best: Paris 2024
programme.desc: Relive the Paris 2024 Olympic Games through the journeys of eight remarkable athletes who pushed past limits, defied expectations, and inspired the world. Featuring Noah Lyles, Faith Kipyegon, Jack Robinson, Huang Yaqiong and Zheng Siwei, Leon Marchand, Olga Kharlan and Cindy Ngamba.

programme.title: Women's -57kg & Men's -68kg Repechages/Finals | Taekwondo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's -57kg & Men's -68kg Repechages/Finals which took place at the Grand Palais on 08/08/24.
The Women's -57Kg was won by Yujin Kim (KOR) with Gold, Nahid Kiyanichandeh (IRI) with Silver and a tie in Bronze by Skylar Park (CAN) and Alizadeh Kimia (BUL).
The Men's -68kg was won by Ulugbek Rashitov (UZB) with Gold, Zaid Kareem (JOR) with Silver and Bronze for Yushuai Liang (CHN) and Edival Pontes (BRA).

programme.title: Men's 110m Hurdles Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 110m Hurdles Final took place at Stade de France, on 08/08/24. Grant Holloway (USA) won Gold with a time of 12.99 seconds. Daniel Roberts (USA) won Silver, and Rasheed Broadbell (JAM) completed the podium.

programme.title: Final Men's 200m | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 200m Final took place at Stade de France, on 08/08/24. Letsile Tebogo (BOT) won Gold with a time of 19.46sec. Kenneth Bednarek (USA) took Silver, and Noah Lyles (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Final Women's 400m Hurdles | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 400m Hurdles Final took place at Stade de France, on 08/08/24. Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone (USA) won Gold with a World Record time of 50.37 seconds. Anna Cockrell (USA) won Silver, and Femke Bol (NED) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's Javelin Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Javelin Throw Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 08/08/2024. Arshad Nadeem (PAK) won the Golden Medal, Neeraj CHOPRA (IND) Silver Medal and Anderson PETERS (GRN) Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Women's Long Jump Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Long Jump Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 08/08/2024. Tara DAVIS-WOODHALL (USA) won the Gold medal, Malaika MIHAMBO (GER) won the Silver medal and Jasmine MOORE (USA) won the Bronze medal.

programme.title: Women's 10km | Marathon Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10Km Marathon Swimming Race was held on 08/08/2024 at Paris Pont Alexandre III. Sharon Van Rouwendaal (NED) claimed Gold with a time of 2:03:34.2, Moesha Johnson (AUS) took Silver andGinevra Taddeucci (ITA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Personal Best: Paris 2024
programme.desc: Relive the Paris 2024 Olympic Games through the journeys of eight remarkable athletes who pushed past limits, defied expectations, and inspired the world. Featuring Noah Lyles, Faith Kipyegon, Jack Robinson, Huang Yaqiong and Zheng Siwei, Leon Marchand, Olga Kharlan and Cindy Ngamba.

programme.title: Women's Lead Semi-Final, Men's Speed Final | Sport Climbing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's Boulder & Lead Semi-Final, the Men's Speed Quarter-Final, Men's Speed Semi-Final and the Men's Speed Final which took place at Le Bourget Sport Climbing Venue on 08/08/24.
The Men's Speed Final was won by Veddriq Leonardo (INA) with Gold, Wu Peng (CHN) with Silver and Sam Watson (USA) with Bronze.

programme.title: Heats, Quarter-Finals, Semi-Finals & Finals | Canoe Sprint | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's Canoe Single 200m Heats, the Men's Canoe Double 500m Semi-Finals, the Women's Kayak Four 500m Semi-Finals, the Men's Kayak Four 500m Semi-Finals, the Women's Canoe Single 200m Quarter-Finals, the Men's Canoe Double 500m Finals, the Women's Kayak Four 500m Finals and the Men's Kayak Four 500m Finals which took place at the Vaires-Sur-Marne Nautical Stadium on 08/08/24.
The Men's Canoe Double 500m Finals were won by Liu Hao/Ji Bowen (CHN) with Gold, Gabriele Casadei/Carlo Tacchini (ITA) with Silver and Joan Antoni Moreno/Diego Dominguez (ESP) with Bronze.
The Women's Kayak Four 500m Finals were won by New Zealand who won Gold, Germany won Silver and Hungary won Bronze.
The Men's Kayak Four 500m Finals were won by Germany who won Gold, Australia won Silver and Spain won Bronze.
